TEXT_EDIT_WARNING: Note! Editing badges will change badges already assigned to users. Use with caution to prevent upsetting your community.
TEXT_CREATE_BADGE_INTRO: To create a badge, first we have to pick the badge type, and how it will look. Badges can either display as styled text or a custom image.
TEXT_JAVASCRIPT_REQUIRED: This page requires JavaScript to work properly.
TEXT_MANUAL_BADGE_NOTE: This badge can only be awarded manually by administrators or moderators.
TEXT_THRESHOLD_NOTE: This will be used to determine if the user gets the badge.
TEXT_URL_ID_NOTE: The URL, or page id, the user has to comment on to earn the badge.
TEXT_DISPLAY_LABEL_NOTE: The name commenters will see associated with the badge.
TEXT_DESCRIPTION_NOTE: An optional description to describe the badge. Shown when mousing over a badge.
TEXT_ENABLED_NOTE: If a badge is disabled it will no longer be awarded to new users. If it's a manual badge, it won't be available for moderators to award.
BUTTON_CLICK_TO_SET_IMAGE: Click to set a badge image
TEXT_BACKGROUND_COLOR_NOTE: The color that displays behind the badge text.
TEXT_BORDER_COLOR_NOTE: The border color of the badge.
TEXT_TEXT_COLOR_NOTE: The color of the text in the badge.
TEXT_CSS_CLASS_NOTE: An optional css class that can be used to further style the badge using Custom CSS.
TEXT_REPLACES_BADGE_NOTE: For example, you could have a "Top Commenter" badge that replaces a "New Commenter" badge automatically. The user will still have both badges, but the new one will be displayed instead.
